intro: Descantaria elongata, commonly known as the long-stemmed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its elongated, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Descantaria elongata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
